question: If you throw me out of a window, you’ll leave a grieving wife. If you leave me in the middle of the door, you might just save a life. What am I?
What question can someone ask all day long, always get totally different answers, and yet all the answers could be correct?
Which insect is the smallest?
What day it is on the third day of the week if the week starts with Tuesday?
Why do we stop when the traffic light turns red?
right_option: Because we obey the traffic rule.
option2: Because we decide to show off at the intersection.
option3: Because we want to take a rest.

question: How many consonants are there in the English alphabet?

What grows quicker?

Which reptile, according to the song, should you never smile at?

Which two parts of the body continue to grow for your entire life?
What has 13 hearts but no organs?
I can bring a smile to your face, a tear to your eye, or even a thought to your mind. But, I can’t be seen. What am I?
I can be made and I can be played. I can be cracked and I can be told. What am I?
What is the next number in the following sequence– 7, 14, 21, 28?
What makes up (approx.) 80% of our brain’s volume?
How many months do we have in a year?
How many colors are there in a rainbow?
Without fingers I point, without arms I strike, without feet I run. What am I?
How many days are there in a year?

 2 * 3 - 3 = ?

option1: The world's very first chat room.

question: I'm strong as a rock, but a word can destroy me. What am I?
I'm called thick when close to the ground, but people smile when I'm high. What am I?
The more you cut me the bigger I grow. What am I?
